text.text: Teach me about the Dashboard in ZOLL Billing.

text: The Dashboard is the first page you land on when you log onto ZOLL Billing. Here, you will see claim assignments, tagged claims, and a list of claims by status. You can easily access claims you worked on today, create or enter work flows for incomplete, follow-up, and denied claims, and view import issues that need your attention.

text.text: What can I do on the Dashboard?

text: On the Dashboard, you can see claim assignments, tagged claims, and a list of claims by status. You can also access claims you worked on today, create or enter work flows for incomplete, follow-up, and denied claims, and view import issues that need your attention.

text.text: Explain the features of the Dashboard.

text: The Dashboard is a powerful tool that offers a wide range of features and functionalities. You can see claim assignments, tagged claims, and a list of claims by status. You can also access claims you worked on today, create or enter work flows for incomplete, follow-up, and denied claims, and view import issues that need your attention.

text.text: How do I utilize the Dashboard for managing claims efficiently?

text:
The Dashboard is a powerful tool that can be used to manage claims efficiently. Here are some tips for using the Dashboard effectively:

* Use the filters to quickly find the claims you are looking for.
* Use the tags to organize your claims and keep track of their progress.
* Create work flows to automate your claim processing tasks.
* Use the import issues tool to identify and resolve any problems with your claims data.

By using the Dashboard effectively, you can save time and improve the efficiency of your claim processing.

text.text: where can i access claims you worked on today?

text: You can access claims you worked on today by opening the Dashboard and clicking "My claims viewed today".

text.text: what all components can i find in dashboard?

text:
The Dashboard includes the following components:
* Claim assignments
* Tagged claims
* List of claims by status
* Claims you worked on today
* Work flows for incomplete, follow-up, and denied claims
* Import issues that need your attention

text.text: where can i follow work flow for denied claim?

text: From the Denial Claims page, click the claim number to go to the Claim page to work the denial or the patient name to view the Account page.

text.text: what is use of claim by status?

text: The "Claims by status" section displays claims by status categories and status reason.

text.text: How can I view assigned claims on the Dashboard?

text: The Dashboard is the first page you land on when you log onto ZOLL Billing. Here, you will see claim assignments, tagged claims, and a list of claims by status. You can easily access claims you worked on today, create or enter work flows for incomplete, follow-up, and denied claims, and view import issues that need your attention.

text.text: What actions can I take with assigned claims?

text: You can pick and choose which claims to assign by clicking the claim line. As you pick a link, it highlights in yellow. When you are done, click Assign selected.

text.text: Can you show me how to reassign claims?

text: You can reassign the incomplete claim you are creating to someone else by clicking on the incomplete claim in your Inbox or finding it through the Dashboard. Then, click the edit icon next to the "Assigned to" field and select a name from the list.

text.text: How do I unassign a claim from a Biller?

text: On the Claim page, click the X next to the person's name in the "Assign to" field. Then, click Save.

text.text: What is Advanced Search used for in assigning claims?

text: You can use Advanced Search to assign or reassign claims.

text.text: What are reminders due in ZOLL Billing?

text: You can tell ZOLL Billing to remind you to work a claim at a later date by setting a follow-up reminder.

text.text: How do I set a follow-up reminder for a claim?

text: On the Claim page, click Schedule follow-up reminder. Select the date from the calendar. Click Save.

text.text: Show me how to cancel a follow-up reminder

text: On the Claim page, click Edit on the follow-up reminder banner. Click Delete.

text.text: What permissions are required for claim assignment?

text: Claim assignment is tied to user roles/permissions.

text.text: How are claims automatically assigned when a reminder is set?

text: If the claim was not assigned at the time the reminder was set, it will automatically be assigned to the person setting the reminder.

text.text: Assigning one or more claims using Advanced Search

text:
1. On the navigation bar, click 'Advanced'.
2. Enter the criteria you wish to search on and then click Search.
3. You can assign one or multiple claims at once by clicking the row the claim is on.
4. When you are done, click Assign selected.

text.text: Assigning a single claim on the Claim page

text:
1. On the Claim page, click the "Assigned to" field.
2. Select the name from the list.
3. Click Save.
For more information click this: https://help.zollonline.com/billing/Content/Videos.htm?wchannelid=m8t21u1viq&wmediaid=b5m2qc0mtu

text.text: Reassigning a claim from the Claim page

text:
1. On the Claim page, click the "Assigned to" field.
2. Select the name from the list.
3. Click Save.
For more information click this: https://help.zollonline.com/billing/Content/Videos.htm?wchannelid=m8t21u1viq&wmediaid=b5m2qc0mtu

text.text: Unassigning the claim from the Claim page

text:
1. On the Claim page, click the X next to the person's name in the "Assign to" field.
2. Click Save.
For more information click this: https://help.zollonline.com/billing/Content/Videos.htm?wchannelid=m8t21u1viq&wmediaid=d3on7np6za

text.text: Explain the significance of the "Claim Assignment & Reminders" section?

text: The "Claim Assignment & Reminders" section of the Dashboard allows you to see claims assigned to users.

text.text: How do I handle import failures in ZOLL Billing?

text:
Import failures can occur for a variety of reasons. Here are some common causes and solutions:

* The file format is not correct. Make sure the file is in the correct format and that it has the correct column headers.
* The file is missing required fields. Make sure the file includes all of the required fields.
* The file contains invalid data. Make sure the data in the file is valid.
* The file is too large. The maximum file size for imports is 100MB.
* The import is being processed too quickly. The system can only process a certain number of imports at a time. If you are trying to import a large number of files, try splitting them up into smaller batches.
* The import is being processed during a maintenance window. The system is unavailable for imports during maintenance windows.

If you are still having trouble with import failures, please contact Zoll Billing support for assistance.

text.text: How do I access more information about import failure messages?

text: To read more about those messages, click here. https://help.zollonline.com/billing/Content/The Dashboard/Claim Import Issues Message.htm

text.text: what happen when NEMSIS or batch import fails?

text: When a NEMSIS or batch import fails, there is a clickable warning message that displays in the upper left corner of the Dashboard.

text.text: How do I manage high priority claims workflow on the Dashboard?

text: An unadjudicated claim is automatically moved into follow-up after 30 days. If there are unassigned follow-up claims in your system, the Work button displays. Click the Work button to see a list of follow-up claims.

text.text: Explain the process for manual submission of claims on the Dashboard.

text: Click Dashboard on the navigation bar. The number of manual submission claims displays next to the "Queued for submission - manual submission" banner. If the number is greater than zero, a Work button displays. Click the work button to get started.

text.text: What happens if a claim needs to be dropped to paper in ZOLL Billing?

text: Use this procedure to drop a claim to paper that is usually sent electronically.

text.text: Teach me how to work follow-up claims using the Dashboard.

text: An unadjudicated claim is automatically moved into follow-up after 30 days. If there are unassigned follow-up claims in your system, the Work button displays. Click the Work button to see a list of follow-up claims.

text.text: How are unadjudicated claims handled after 30 days in ZOLL Billing?

text: An unadjudicated claim is automatically moved into follow-up after 30 days.

text.text: Guide me through working denied claims on the Dashboard.

text: If there are denied claims in the system, the 'Work' button displays. Click Work to see a list of all denied claims (assigned and unassigned denials display).

text.text: Show me how to view and filter follow-up claims by payer on the Dashboard

text:
To view and filter follow-up claims by payer on the Dashboard, follow these steps:

1. Click the Dashboard tab.
2. Click the Follow-up tab.
3. Click the Filter button.
4. Select the payer from the list.
5. Click the Apply button.

The list of follow-up claims will be filtered by the selected payer.

text.text: What actions can I take when I encounter denied claims in ZOLL Billing?

text: If there are denied claims in the system, the 'Work' button displays. Click Work to see a list of all denied claims (assigned and unassigned denials display).

text.text: Explain the process of assigning denied claims to billing specialists

text:
To assign one or more denied claims on the Denial Claims page to a billing specialist:

1. On the Denial Claims page, click the row or check the box if the claim you want to assign. The color will change from white to yellow. You can select as many rows as you wish.
2. Click Assign selected.
3. Click the Select user column and then select the billing specialist's name from the drop-down list.
4. Click Assign.

text.text: Provide instructions for customizing columns on the Denial Claims page

text:
To customize the columns on the Denial Claims page:

1. On the Denial Claims page, click Customize columns at the top right of the page.
2. Use the arrows to move the columns that you don't want to see from the Visible side to the Hidden side.
3. Click Save.
For more information click this: https://help.zollonline.com/billing/Content/Videos.htm?wchannelid=m8t21u1viq&wmediaid=d3on7np6za

text.text: Working follow-up claims on the Dashboard

text: An unadjudicated claim is automatically moved into follow-up after 30 days. If there are unassigned follow-up claims in your system, the Work button displays. Click the Work button to see a list of follow-up claims.

text.text: Working denied claims

text: If there are denied claims in the system, the 'Work' button displays. Click Work to see a list of all denied claims (assigned and unassigned denials display).

text.text: Customiz the columns

text:
To customize the columns on the Denial Claims page:

1. On the Denial Claims page, click Customize columns at the top right of the page.
2. Use the arrows to move the columns that you don't want to see from the Visible side to the Hidden side.
3. Click Save.

text.text: how to Assign or re-assign denied claims?

text:
To assign or re-assign denied claims:

1. On the Denial Claims page, click the row or check the box if the claim you want to assign. The color will change from white to yellow. You can select as many rows as you wish.
2. Click Assign selected.
3. Click the Select user column and then select the billing specialist's name from the drop-down list.
4. Click Assign.

text.text: Assigning all denied claims at once

text:
To assign all denied claims listed on the Denial Claims page to a single billing specialist:

1. On the Denial Claims page, click the selection box in the heading.
2. Click Assign selected.
3. Click the Select user column and then select the billing specialist's name from the drop-down list.
4. Click Assign.

text.text: how do i Select specific claims to assign?

text:
To select specific claims to assign:

1. Review the table and select the checkbox next to each claim that you would like to apply the tag to.
2. Click Assign selected.
3. Click the Select user column and then select the billing specialist's name from the drop-down list.
4. Click Assign.

text.text: How do I manage incomplete claims workflow on the Dashboard?

text:
Incomplete claims are claims that have not been fully adjudicated. They may be pending adjudication, pending payment, or pending rejection.

To manage incomplete claims workflow on the Dashboard, follow these steps:

1. Click the Dashboard tab.
2. Click the Incomplete Claims tab.
3. Use the filters to view a specific type of incomplete claim.
4. Click the Work button to view the details of a claim.
5. Click the Adjudicate button to adjudicate the claim.
6. Click the Pay button to pay the claim.
7. Click the Reject button to reject the claim.

text.text: Can you explain the process for handling incomplete claims in ZOLL Billing?

text:
Incomplete claims are claims that have not been fully adjudicated. They may be pending adjudication, pending payment, or pending rejection.

To manage incomplete claims workflow on the Dashboard, follow these steps:

1. Click the Dashboard tab.
2. Click the Incomplete Claims tab.
3. Use the filters to view a specific type of incomplete claim.
4. Click the Work button to view the details of a claim.
5. Click the Adjudicate button to adjudicate the claim.
6. Click the Pay button to pay the claim.
7. Click the Reject button to reject the claim.

text.text: What actions can I take if there are unassigned incomplete claims in the system?

text:
If there are unassigned incomplete claims in the system, you can take the following actions:

1. Click the Work oldest button to work on the oldest unassigned claim.
2. Click the Pick claims button to select specific claims to work on.
3. Click the Un-assign button to unassign claims that have been assigned to you.
4. Click the Assign selected button to assign claims to another user.

text.text: Teach me how to work incomplete claims efficiently using the Dashboard.

text:
Incomplete claims are claims that have not been fully adjudicated. They may be pending adjudication, pending payment, or pending rejection.

To manage incomplete claims workflow on the Dashboard, follow these steps:

1. Click the Dashboard tab.
2. Click the Incomplete Claims tab.
3. Use the filters to view a specific type of incomplete claim.
4. Click the Work button to view the details of a claim.
5. Click the Adjudicate button to adjudicate the claim.
6. Click the Pay button to pay the claim.
7. Click the Reject button to reject the claim.

text.text: What are the different statuses of incomplete claims and their meanings?

text:
Incomplete claims are claims that have not been fully adjudicated. They may be pending adjudication, pending payment, or pending rejection.

The following table lists the different statuses of incomplete claims and their meanings:

| Status | Meaning |
|---|---|
| Pending adjudication | The claim has not yet been adjudicated. |
| Pending payment | The claim has been adjudicated and is waiting to be paid. |
| Pending rejection | The claim has been adjudicated and is waiting to be rejected. |

text.text: How do I verify patient account information for incomplete claims?

text:
To verify patient account information for incomplete claims:

1. Click the Work button next to Incomplete - Verify patient account.
2. Verify the patient accounts.
3. If one of the records match, click the button to the left of the listing.
4. If no records on the list match, click the "Nope!" line to create a new record.

text.text: How do I clear claim ownership for incomplete claims?

text: Claims in your work queue will be assigned to you until you either clear the work queue or the work queue expires (after seven days).

text.text: Explain the process of adding attachments to incomplete claims.

text:
To add attachments to incomplete claims:

1. Bring up the incomplete claim via the Dashboard > "Incomplete claim" button or hover over Claims and then click Imported Claims.
2. On the Imported Claims page, scroll down the list and then click the blue claim number associated with import.
3. On the Incomplete Claim page, click the Attachments link.
4. On the Attachments window, click the File type field and select a type from the list.
5. Click Choose File to navigate to the location on your computer where the file resides.
6. Click Upload.
7. After the file successfully uploads, then click Attach to associate the file with the claim.
8. Click Close.

text.text: How can I efficiently navigate through the incomplete claims workflow on the Dashboard?

text:
Incomplete claims are claims that have not been fully adjudicated. They may be pending adjudication, pending payment, or pending rejection.

To manage incomplete claims workflow on the Dashboard, follow these steps:

1. Click the Dashboard tab.
2. Click the Incomplete Claims tab.
3. Use the filters to view a specific type of incomplete claim.
4. Click the Work button to view the details of a claim.
5. Click the Adjudicate button to adjudicate the claim.
6. Click the Pay button to pay the claim.
7. Click the Reject button to reject the claim.

text.text: What should I do if I encounter missing information in an incomplete claim?

text: Information on incomplete claims must be verified and missing information provided before you can submit or suspend the claim.

text.text: Incomplete - Verify patient account

text: If the claim displays in this area it means that some aspects of the patient demographic information in the imported claim matches existing records. You do not work the claims in this section, only verify the patient information. The number shown for 'Incomplete - Verify patient account' is a subset of the 'Incomplete' total. For example, you might have eight incomplete claims, four of which need patient verication. Or you might see eight Incomplete claims where all eight need patient verication. In this case, note the following: Click the Work button next to Incomplete - Verify patient account and verify the patient accounts rst. Clicking the Pick claims button next to Incomplete will not work until the claim(s) are veried.

text.text: what should i do when i imported claim is a duplicate of an existing claim?

text: Review the information. If the imported claim is a duplicate of an existing claim, click "Yes, merge this claim." If it is not, click "No, create a new claim."

text.text: Adding a claim to an existing work queue

text:
1. Click Dashboard on the navigation bar.
2. Click Pick claims.
3. To select a date, click the box on the calendar. The box highlights in yellow. If you made an error, deselect the box by clicking it again.
4. When you are done selecting the dates, click Work selected claims.
For more information click this: https://help.zollonline.com/billing/Content/Videos.htm?wchannelid=m8t21u1viq&wmediaid=usvcjwlium

text.text: Clearing claim ownership

text: Claims in your work queue will be assigned to you until you either clear the work queue or the work queue expires (after seven days).

text.text: what are the steps to clear the assignment?

text:
1. Click Advanced Search.
2. Under the 'Claim Information' heading, click the Claim status column.
3. Select Incomplete from the list and then click Search.
4. On the table that displays, find the Assigned to column and then enter your name in the filter box.
5. Click Search.
A list of incomplete claims that are assigned to you displays.

text.text: how to add notes and attachments?

text: Both attachments and notes can be added on any page in the incomplete claim workow. Add notes as you work the claim. For example, if you clicked Save and exit you may want to create a note as to why.

text.text: what is the use work oldest button?

text: Clicking the Work oldest button on the Dashboard puts you into the incomplete workow. Once in this workow, you will be served up the next oldest unassigned claim as you nish the rst. This will continue until all claims are submitted or suspended.

text.text: I left the work queue what should i do now?

text: You can leave the queue at anytime (even after you log off) and come back to the very spot you left. Just click Work queue on the navigation bar.

text.text: what is the main usage of Work oldest button ?

text: Clicking the Work oldest button on the Dashboard puts you into the incomplete workow. Once in this workow, you will be served up the next oldest unassigned claim as you nish the rst. This will continue until all claims are submitted or suspended.

text.text: How does incomplete cliams work?

text: Incomplete - Verify patient account: If the claim displays in this area it means that some aspects of the patient demographic information in the imported claim matches existing records. You do not work the claims in this section, only verify the patient information.

text.text: How to use the create work queue option?

text: To create a work queue, you can either click the "Pick claims" button on the Dashboard (for unassigned claims) or check the boxes next to the claims you want to work on in your Inbox (for claims assigned to you). Once you have selected the claims, click "Work selected claims" to enter the work queue.

text.text: what is the usage tags?

text: Tags are an easy way to customize the grouping of claims and create your own statuses. They can be created with any name you wish and then applied to claims as you work on them. You can apply as many tags as needed to a claim.

text.text: How to Add a tag to a single claim or to multiple claims at once.

text:
1. On the Claim page, click 'Add a tag.
2. Enter the tag name. If the tag already exists, select it from the list.
3. Click Add tag.
For more information click this: https://help.zollonline.com/billing/Content/Videos.htm?wchannelid=m8t21u1viq&wmediaid=kpkl01z2vs

text.text: Remove a tag on the Claim page

text: To remove a tag on the Claim page, click the X next to the tag name.
For more information click this: https://help.zollonline.com/billing/Content/Videos.htm?wchannelid=m8t21u1viq&wmediaid=b5m2qc0mtu
